heading: all-in-one dsl modem chips
subheading: got analog or dsl service? lucent's new modem chipset is ready for both -- which is probably a good thing, too.
author: wired news report
text: will your local given adsl's still-evolving status, few can know for sure. for this uncertain landscape, lucent has developed an equally ambiguous chipset ready for both conditions.built into a modem, the company's new the chipset automatically detects whether or not the phone company's switching office has a subscriber line connection and uses it if it does. lucent says this precludes having to reconfigure pcs from 56-kbps to dsl settings.working with telecom consortium though observers have lauded the early unity on adsl standards, few expect the technology to appear as quickly as some have claimed (by year's end, according to the optimists). the working group grew out of dissatisfaction with the lack of progress being made by the telephone companies, who play a key role in the development of adsl. before that, many considered cable modem likely to beat adsl as the medium for high-speed consumer access to the internet.
